articles.title: What to know about Signal, the app used by Trump officials to text war plans
articles.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and other Trump officials allegedly used Signal for a group chat to discuss a highly sensitive operation.
articles.content: An encrypted messaging app called Signal is drawing attention and questions after top Trump officials — including Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and Vice President JD Vance — allegedly used the service to discuss a highly sensitive military operation... [7045 chars]

articles.title: When Danielle Smith tried explaining Poilievre to Americans, Canadians heard it too
articles.description: Alberta's premier has given U.S. media outlets several reasons Trump should avoid tariffs. But her electoral rationale landed differently in Canada.
articles.content:
Alberta Premier Danielle Smith came into the federal election campaign hoping her words would leave an imprint.
Well, maybe not like this.

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Donald Trump urged to fire US defence secretary Pete Hegseth after leaking of military plans
articles.description: The US president has attempted to downplay the leak of US airstrikes on Yemen's Houtis to a journalist via the Signal messaging app, suggesting the chat among high-ranking officials contained "no classified information".
articles.content:
Donald Trump has been urged to fire US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth as the fallout from the leak of highly sensitive war plans via an encrypted messaging app continues.

articles.title: Judge halts Trump admin's try to deport Columbia protester Yunseo Chung
articles.description: Yunseo Chung was arrested outside the hours-long takeover of a Barnard College library.

articles.title: Court allows Trump administration to suspend approval of new refugees
articles.description: The Trump administration can stop approving new refugees for entry into the U.S. but has to allow in people who were conditionally accepted.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Judicial Authority Clash: House Speaker Warns of Looming Court Eliminations
articles.description: U.S. House Speaker, Mike Johnson, highlighted Congress's power to remove district courts amid tensions with activist judges obstructing Trump's policies. Johnson described nationwide judicial injunctions as unconstitutional, with Congress poised to act. The issue has sparked debate, with Senate resistance anticipated despite Republican initiatives.
